meanings.definition: The group of clients or customers served by a business.
meanings.sent1: The clientage of the store includes loyal customers who visit regularly.
meanings.sent2: The clientage at the restaurant was diverse, with people from different backgrounds.
meanings.sent3: The clientage waiting in line for the new phone release looked eager and excited.
meanings.sent4: The clientage of the gym transformed into a community of health enthusiasts.
meanings.sent5: The clientage of the salon enjoyed the pampering services offered.

meanings.definition: The relationship between a client and a professional providing services.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer valued the clientage he had built over the years.
meanings.sent2: The clientage with the financial advisor was based on trust and expertise.
meanings.sent3: The clientage joked that their accountant knew more about their finances than they did.
meanings.sent4: The clientage and the consultant worked together to achieve successful outcomes.
meanings.sent5: The clientage appreciated the dedication of their personal trainer.

meanings.definition: The state of being a client or customer.
meanings.sent1: The clientage experienced excellent service during their visit.
meanings.sent2: The clientage received discounts for being loyal customers.
meanings.sent3: The clientage happily browsed through the new products on display.
meanings.sent4: The clientage felt valued and appreciated by the attentive staff.
meanings.sent5: The clientage eagerly awaited the launch of the online store.
